result.execSummary:
The defendant Sage R M Beckmann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court has set a Probation Review Hearing for 5/25/17 at 3:00 pm.  If defendant is complying with conditions of probation, he and agent can appear by phone for hearing. If defendant is not complying, he's to be in court in person.

miscConds.notes: $500 fine plus costs on Ct. 1. To pay court appointed attorney fees (due Door County) in an amount to be determined.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

To pay the costs of the action on Ct. 2.  To pay court appointed attorney fees (due Door County). To repay the Door/Kewaunee Drug Task Force for buy money, joint and several with Austin Hanson.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
Defendant is eligible for expungement under Wis. Stat. 973.015 upon successful completion of Probation and all conditions.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments, including AODA assessment, as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay a DNA surcharge.

timeConds.notes: To perform 150 hours of uncompensated community service with a not-for-profit agency.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sage R M Beckmann in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minute sheet. State files an Amended Information with only Cts. 1 & 2. State gives plea agreement.  Court questions defendant on change of plea.  Rights/elements/max. penalties reviewed with defendant.  Defendant enters no contest plea to Cts. 1 & 2.  Defense stipulates to factual basis to accept plea.  Court finds pleas made freely, knowingly and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds guilty of Cts. 1 & 2.   Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Defendant must have a DNA sample on file with the State of Wisconsin and pay and DNA surcharge. State/Defense ready to proceed to sentencing without the benefit of a PSI. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendation. Court makes statement, imposes sentence. Bond is no longer in effect.

Defendant Sage R M Beckmann in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file.  Court reschedules matter to next week. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 10:00 am.
State's Discovery Demand
Defense Discovery Demand
Contract for Repayment of Court-appointed Attorney Fees
Assuming the Information mirrors the criminal complaint, defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea.  Bond remains as is.

Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover. DA will file the Information and Discovery Demand later today.

Defendant Sage R M Beckmann in court with attorney Stephen Pleck Johnson.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Atty Johnson accepts court appointment. Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to preliminary hearing. Defense waives reading of the complaint, indicates defendant would like to waive his right to a preliminary hearing today.  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 03:45 pm.
Court appoints Atty Steve Johnson to represent defendant. Defendant to pay $75 per month toward atty fees. First payment due 5/01/16.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed.  Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.  To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving the Justice Center.

Defendant Sage R M Beckmann appears by video conference along with attorney Gregory Allen Gerbers who appears by phone.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 4/04/16 at 10:00 am.
